title: VCVTQQ2PD â€” Convert Packed Quadword Integers to Packed Double-Precision Floating-Point Values

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`VCVTQQ2PD xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2/m128/m64bcst`
`VCVTQQ2PD ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2/m256/m64bcst`
`VCVTQQ2PD zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2/m512/m64bcst{er}`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: Converts packed quadword integers in the source operand (second operand) to packed double-precision floating-point values in the destination operand (first operand).

fields.name: ​
fields.value: The source operand is a ZMM/YMM/XMM register or a 512/256/128-bit memory location. The destination operation is a ZMM/YMM/XMM register conditionally updated with writemask k1.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: EVEX.vvvv is reserved and must be 1111b otherwise instructions will #UD.

footer.text: Thanks to Felix Cloutier for the online x86 reference
